item.title: Acoustic modes in M67 cluster stars trace deepening convective envelopes
item.description:
Stars constantly vibrate with acoustic waves that travel through their interiors. These vibrations carry detailed information about the physical structure hidden beneath a star‚Äôs surface. By studying the frequency patterns of these oscillations, we can measure things like a star‚Äôs density and even estimate its age.

Two types of frequency differences are particularly important: large separations, which are sensitive to the average density of the star, and small separations, which are linked to the structure of the stellar core. In main-sequence stars like the Sun, small separations provide a powerful window into the core‚Äôs properties and can be used to estimate stellar ages.

item.title: Asteroseismology of M67: Seismic Characterisation Across Evolutionary Phases
item.description:
Ensemble asteroseismology has revolutionized our ability to empirically link observed seismic properties to fundamental stellar parameters. Star clusters, with their uniform metallicity, distance, and age, provide an ideal environment for refining these relations.

In this study, we present the first asteroseismic analysis of M67 that spans its full evolutionary sequence, from subgiants to core helium-burning red giants, including a yellow straggler.

Using Kepler/K2 data, we measure seismic surface gravity, examine the potential role of core magnetic fields, and derive an empirical expression for the seismic surface term. We also extend the analysis of the asymptotic phase term …õ to evolutionary stages previously unexplored in detail.

item.title: Isochrone Fitting of M67 in the Gaia Era: Refining Stellar Models for Open Cluster Studies
item.description:
The Gaia mission has transformed our understanding of open clusters by significantly reducing scatter in colour-magnitude diagrams (CMDs). This improvement allows for more precise stellar modelling, making M67 an ideal test case.

Using Gaia‚Äôs refined CMD, we developed new stellar models that avoid common simplifications in 1D modelling, such as mass-independent core overshooting and a constant mixing length parameter. This approach led to an isochrone tailored specifically for M67, now available for download.
